numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a large gap in the admission likelihood to a college between income ranks.
2. A person in the top 0.1% income rank is 7 times as likely to be admitted to a college as another person.
4. I wonder if more recognition of this problem will create change.
5. I ask how this issue can be solved.
6. I ask if this issue will ever be truly solved.
7. I am a junior in high school.
8. I am starting to look at colleges.
9. I am starting to apply to colleges.
10. This information gives more information about the admission process.
11. This information affects how I perceive different colleges.
12. This information might affect my decision-making when I apply to colleges.
13. The headline is: Rigged or Real? The Truth About College Admissions:
